name: Crowne Plaza Fort Lauderdale Airport / Cruise Port

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: first impressions of the crowne plaza fort lauderdale was less than impressive as there was a minimal front desk and lobby . fast check in was the order of the day and a brief sales pitch for the in house restaurant . having made our own way to our room we were pleased with the size and quality of the room . the hotel to cruise terminal shuttle ( chargable ) was well organised but slow .
reviews.title: good stopover for the cruise terminal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Crowne Plaza is our go to hotel pre-cruise when leaving from Ft. Lauderdale. It is just up the road from the port. You can see the ships in the morning from the roof pool. The hotel doesn't have free breakfast but it is reasonably priced and very good. They run shuttles from the hotel to the port but you can also ask them to get you a taxi. The pool area is very nice. There is a restaurant around the corner that has tremendous pizza - it is a sports bar type place and has excellent food. This is the only place for us when we are leaving on a cruise from Ft. Lauderdale.
reviews.title: Perfect Pre-Cruise Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location if you just doing it for the airport or a cruise. Nothing around in walking distance. Upon check-in got a bag with a water, Doritos’s and a breakfast bar along with a coupon for 2 free drinks if you dined at Kiki‘s their in house restaurant.
reviews.title: Perfect location pre or post cruise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Rooms were modern, clean with very comfortable beds. Room, amenities included coffee maker, microwave, mini refrigerator, shampoo, conditioner, mouth wash, body lotion. There area also free computers available.
reviews.title: Pretty Hotel, Terrible Staff service and transportation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Kiki’s was surprisingly affordable and good. The food was hot and tasty, the free drinks were beers, wine, margaritas, most anything except fancy blender drinks.
reviews.title: The Real Deal Says OK for Everything But Sleeping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was so nice to stay at before our cruise. The desk staff were nice and helpful. Close to airport and port. They have a shuttle to the port but it is cheaper to take a taxi. Had a great stay! Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: What happens when you have a 3 night stay at a hotel especially situated for overnight pre and post cruisers??
reviews.title: Do Not Disturb - means do not enter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You get housekeepers who enter your room without regard to your privacy or circumstance demanding to know when you are checking out!! Even though my departure was greater than 50 hours away. Speaking to the management was useless.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location, very convenient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel felt new, one restaurant,, located in the middle of no where. No stores to walk to, close to the airport. I supported their All Stars Shuttle Service.
reviews.title: Love this property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: Three mornings in a row, disturbed by the maids......they kept walking into my room. AWFUL
reviews.title: Delivers everything you need.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: We booked a shuttle to the pier through the hotel. My husband was having back spasms, so we paid porters to take care of our bags...or so we thought. No porter when shuttle arrived. A free for all with everyone transporting their own luggage. I had to handle 4 bags one of which weighed 50 pounds. All the bags were being thrown in randomly until I asked how they would distinguish cruise lines. Chaos!
reviews.title: Pre cruise disaster

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We took the free shuttle from the airport which was a little confusing to find, but worked out well. The driver was pleasant and helpful as were the front desk staff. We had dinner and breakfast in the hotel restaurant and were pleasantly surprised. The quality was very good and the service was prompt and pleasant. They gave us a voucher for a free drink which was a nice touch. The pool looked great, but we were not there long enough to take advantage. There isn't much of a lobby and you enter via the underground parking - not the best feeling, but I never felt unsafe.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay before or after a cruise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were able to purchase a shuttle ride to the cruise port and also a voucher for the return to the airport. Both were from an independent company and were reasonably priced and prompt.
reviews.title: Really made a difference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: The room itself was a standard hotel room. It was clean and had everything in working order. I found it completely acceptable and would recommend it to anyone needing a place to stay before or after a cruise or flight from Fort Lauderdale airport. There doesn't seem to be much in the area, so I would choose a different location if looking to spend time in the Fort Lauderdale area.
reviews.title: another great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in Fort Lauderdale and set about checking in for. The night.we went to see a hotel on the front. It was awful bed in a closet, feeling down we stumbled on the crowne plaza. The room was Devine 2 beds. Clean
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: We stayed here after our cruise because it was a mile from the ft lauderdale airport and were very happy with the choice. We called ahead to have the complimentary shuttle pick us up and only had to wait a few minutes. Once we got to the hotel (4 hours before check in) they welcomed us and said they were expecting us and quickly checked us in!! Our room was very comfortable and had a fresh Miami style to it! We had a nice view of the sky scrapers in the distance. On the 5th floor is a roof side patio and pool that were nice as well! We ate at the restaurant in the hotel for lunch and had good food!! Would enjoy staying here again!
reviews.title: Refreshing and close to airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for one night as we traveled from Turks and Caicos back home to Alaska. Our American flight from Providenciales came into Miami in the later afternoon whereas our Alaska Airlines flight left early the next morning from Ft. Lauderdale. The Crowne Plaza very neatly fills the need for just such a hotel. It is very close to the Ft. Lauderdale airport making an early morning connection an easy hop. The room was very comfortable. The shower was excepional -- resort quality. The food in the restaurant was, to say the least, very basic and uninspired. Stick with a salad and the free glass of wine. The front desk staff and the van driver were friendly and helpful. Other than the airport and the cruise terminal, the hotel does not appear to be near anything else of interest to a visitor. However, since it was a place to hang our hat for one night, it was perfect for our needs.
reviews.title: Successfully Fills A Niche

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is less than a five minute ride to the cruise terminal in Fort Lauderdale.
reviews.title: Best hotel if taking a cruise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That was a real perk for us as we drove over from the Gulf Coast. This location is not for shopping etc. There isn't any nor any close by restaurants. You may eat in the hotel, and then the hotel clerk told us about a restaurant "Anthony's", a two block walk from hotel. We did both; the hotel was ok...pricey...and Anthony's was really good for pizza and wings. The hotel was very clean, our room was very well cared for, clean and room to move around in! We parked our car in their covered garage for the duration of the cruise at a $7.00 per day charge. All personnel were courteous and helpful. While this hotel is not in a walk about shopping area, it is just the best hotel to use especially if you are taking a cruise. It does have a nice pool area outdoors and gym room Convenient!! We will definitely stay at Crowne Plaza prior to our next cruise! We purchased shuttle tickets to be transported to cruise terminal and voucher for the return to the hotel. No worries, the driver loaded the luggage for all in a small trailer attached to the van and off we went! Same on return. Glad we discovered this little gem of a hotel and the transport service!
reviews.title: Beautiful Place to Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: we stopped there for the night before heading out to Puerto Rico for vacation, this hotel was comfortable beautiful and the friendly staff made our evening memorable, the food in the restaurant was delightful!
reviews.title: Beautiful Premier-Class Best Western Crowne Plaza Hotel

aka: Crowne Plaza Fort Lauderdale Airport / Cruise Port Hotel Fort Lauderdale
description: Welcome to Fort Lauderdale's newest vibrant urban full service hotel! The Crowne Plaza Fort Lauderdale Airport / Cruise Port is modern, elegantly designed, chic, and centrally located to all Fort Lauderdale's South Florida events and attractions. Ideal for corporate or leisure and the most discerning traveler. The Crowne Plaza Fort Lauderdale Airport / Cruise Port is located at the entrance of Port Everglades Cruise Port and less than a mile from Fort Lauderdale Int'l Airport (FLL), Broward County Convention Center and 2 miles from Downtown Fort Lauderdale.
